Topic.Title: Hate to break it to you pumperz, but Holiday sales are very weak

Message.Msg: Amazon is heading to $180 in a massive shakeout of overconfident speculative traders.... Average order size down across all e-commerce reports, destroying what little profit might have been left for Amazon. Retail funds with competent active management will rotate to eBay because its economics actually scale well in this environment (and according to ComScore its YOY growth rate is accelerating where Amazon's is decelerating and its growth rate is higher with a sane multiple). Tech funds with competent active management will rotate to GOOG which likewise has economics that work in this environment and it going after Amazon's few cash flow generators...

I also signed up for free one month prime membership. The book I wanted was not on the free lending list. I already have a Netflix account, so I don't need any videos. I'll probably cancel before my free membershil expires.

Topic.Title: Hate to break it to you pumperz, but Holiday sales are very weak

Message.Msg: FedEx (probably joined by UPS) report slow holiday volume. Besides, Sybil sez $264 was the all time high ordained by the trading gods.

Message.Title: I believe, Local Corp/Spreebird can substitute CommerceInterface, when CommerceInterface will no longer service other retail channels and current customers
Message.Msg: Groupon Buys CommerceInterface To Improve How Vendors Sell On Groupon Goods Groupon had already been using CommerceInterface in its own Groupon Goods operations since April of this year, it said in a release. Groupon Goods is a bit of a soup-to-nuts effort: it’s a platform for different merchants to post sales of diamond jewellery and designer sunglasses, but also mattresses, computers and cutlery. So this could be a matter of the company wanting to better integrate the service as it continues to build up that business, which as of Q3 was on a run rate of $1.5 billion in global billings. Using an outsourced service could be less efficient in that case. CommerceInterface will no longer service other retail channels and current customers will have the option to transition to other vendors over the next six months with migration support from the company.

Topic.Title: Jump off cliff, and get those 50 million off food stamps for starters:)

Message.Msg: Not difficult to understand at all. Check the facts. During the 8 Clinton years, the average FED tax revenue was 19.0% of GDP and he spent 19.8%. During the 4 Obama years receipts have been 15.4% of GDP while he has spent 24.4%. In order to close the 2012 budget gap with no cuts, FED taxes would need to be raised 8.5% on $15T of GDP which equates to $1.28T per year of increased taxes. If you inlcude the effects of the velocity of money on the order of 1.8, that would be a $2.3T impact on the economy, or a 15% drag on GDP ... that is potential depression levels. Even on a real basis, Obama tax reciepts in 2012 are larger than all but 2 years of Clinton. We have a spending problem and attacking the deficit with taxes will crush the economy.
